channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: The Graph Spectral Token: Enhancing Graph Transformers with Spectral Information
item.description: Graph Transformers have emerged as a powerful alternative to Message-Passing Graph Neural Networks (MP-GNNs) to address limitations such as over-squashing of information exchange.

item.title: Sailor: Open Language Models for South-East Asia
item.description: We present Sailor, a family of open language models ranging from 0. 5B to 7B parameters, tailored for South-East Asian (SEA) languages.

item.title: Decoupling Static and Hierarchical Motion Perception for Referring Video Segmentation
item.description: In fact, static cues can sometimes interfere with temporal perception by overshadowing motion cues.

item.title: NLP at UC Santa Cruz at SemEval-2024 Task 5: Legal Answer Validation using Few-Shot Multi-Choice QA
item.description: Secondly, we performed few-shot prompting on GPT models and found that reformulating the answer validation task to be a multiple-choice QA task remarkably improves the performance of the model.

item.title: AdaGlimpse: Active Visual Exploration with Arbitrary Glimpse Position and Scale
item.description: Active Visual Exploration (AVE) is a task that involves dynamically selecting observations (glimpses), which is critical to facilitate comprehension and navigation within an environment.

item.title: Theoretical and Empirical Insights into the Origins of Degree Bias in Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Throughout our analysis, we connect our findings to previously-proposed hypotheses for the origins of degree bias, supporting and unifying some while drawing doubt to others.

item.title: BodyMAP -- Jointly Predicting Body Mesh and 3D Applied Pressure Map for People in Bed
item.description: In contrast, we introduce BodyMAP, which jointly predicts the human body mesh and 3D applied pressure map across the entire human body.

item.title: HandDiff: 3D Hand Pose Estimation with Diffusion on Image-Point Cloud
item.description: Extracting keypoint locations from input hand frames, known as 3D hand pose estimation, is a critical task in various human-computer interaction applications.

item.title: Probing Large Language Models for Scalar Adjective Lexical Semantics and Scalar Diversity Pragmatics
item.description: In this study, we probe different families of Large Language Models such as GPT-4 for their knowledge of the lexical semantics of scalar adjectives and one specific aspect of their pragmatics, namely scalar diversity.

item.title: Does Knowledge Graph Really Matter for Recommender Systems?
item.description: We consider the scenarios where knowledge in a KG gets completely removed, randomly distorted and decreased, and also where recommendations are for cold-start users.

item.title: How Easily do Irrelevant Inputs Skew the Responses of Large Language Models?
item.description: By leveraging the retrieval of information from external knowledge databases, Large Language Models (LLMs) exhibit enhanced capabilities for accomplishing many knowledge-intensive tasks.

item.title: Real-time Noise Source Estimation of a Camera System from an Image and Metadata
item.description: It also serves as a basis to include more advanced noise sources, or as part of an automatic countermeasure feedback-loop to approach fully reliable machines.

item.title: nicolay-r at SemEval-2024 Task 3: Using Flan-T5 for Reasoning Emotion Cause in Conversations with Chain-of-Thought on Emotion States
item.description: Inspired by the most recent advances in Chain-of-Thought, in this work, we exploit the existing three-hop reasoning approach (THOR) to perform large language model instruction-tuning for answering: emotion states (THOR-state), and emotion caused by one speaker to the other (THOR-cause).

item.title: Approximate Gradient Coding for Privacy-Flexible Federated Learning with Non-IID Data
item.description: This work focuses on the challenges of non-IID data and stragglers/dropouts in federated learning.

item.title: Learning From Simplicial Data Based on Random Walks and 1D Convolutions
item.description: Triggered by limitations of graph-based deep learning methods in terms of computational expressivity and model flexibility, recent years have seen a surge of interest in computational models that operate on higher-order topological domains such as hypergraphs and simplicial complexes.

item.title: Benchmarking Parameter Control Methods in Differential Evolution for Mixed-Integer Black-Box Optimization
item.description: Although the PCM of SHADE is state-of-the-art for numerical black-box optimization, our results show its poor performance for mixed-integer black-box optimization.

item.title: Foundation Model for Advancing Healthcare: Challenges, Opportunities, and Future Directions
item.description: To answer these questions, a comprehensive and deep survey of the challenges, opportunities, and future directions of HFMs is presented in this survey.

item.title: SDPose: Tokenized Pose Estimation via Circulation-Guide Self-Distillation
item.description: To mitigate the problem of under-fitting, we design a transformer module named Multi-Cycled Transformer(MCT) based on multiple-cycled forwards to more fully exploit the potential of small model parameters.

item.title: Untangle the KNOT: Interweaving Conflicting Knowledge and Reasoning Skills in Large Language Models
item.description: However, knowledge in the document may conflict with the memory of LLMs due to outdated or incorrect knowledge in the LLMs' parameters.

item.title: Okay, Let's Do This! Modeling Event Coreference with Generated Rationales and Knowledge Distillation
item.description: In NLP, Event Coreference Resolution (ECR) is the task of connecting event clusters that refer to the same underlying real-life event, usually via neural systems.

item.title: Leveraging Interpolation Models and Error Bounds for Verifiable Scientific Machine Learning
item.description: In this work, we present a best-of-both-worlds approach to verifiable scientific machine learning by demonstrating that (1) multiple standard interpolation techniques have informative error bounds that can be computed or estimated efficiently; (2) comparative performance among distinct interpolants can aid in validation goals; (3) deploying interpolation methods on latent spaces generated by deep learning techniques enables some interpretability for black-box models.

item.title: Evaluating LLMs at Detecting Errors in LLM Responses
item.description: This work introduces ReaLMistake, the first error detection benchmark consisting of objective, realistic, and diverse errors made by LLMs.

item.title: Mitigating the Impact of Outlier Channels for Language Model Quantization with Activation Regularization
item.description: We show that regularizing both the inputs and outputs is crucial for preventing a model's "migrating" the difficulty in input quantization to the weights, which makes post-training quantization (PTQ) of weights more difficult.

item.title: AdaBM: On-the-Fly Adaptive Bit Mapping for Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Although image super-resolution (SR) problem has experienced unprecedented restoration accuracy with deep neural networks, it has yet limited versatile applications due to the substantial computational costs.

item.title: Evaluating Generative Language Models in Information Extraction as Subjective Question Correction
item.description: (1) The imprecision of existing evaluation metrics that struggle to effectively gauge semantic consistency between model outputs and ground truth, and (2) The inherent incompleteness of evaluation benchmarks, primarily due to restrictive human annotation schemas, resulting in underestimated LLM performances.

item.title: AI and the Problem of Knowledge Collapse
item.description: While large language models are trained on vast amounts of diverse data, they naturally generate output towards the 'center' of the distribution.

item.title: Is CLIP the main roadblock for fine-grained open-world perception?
item.description: Modern applications increasingly demand flexible computer vision models that adapt to novel concepts not encountered during training.

item.title: EASSE-DE: Easier Automatic Sentence Simplification Evaluation for German
item.description: In this work, we propose EASSE-multi, a framework for easier automatic sentence evaluation for languages other than English.

item.title: Sparse Concept Bottleneck Models: Gumbel Tricks in Contrastive Learning
item.description: We propose a novel architecture and method of explainable classification with Concept Bottleneck Models (CBMs).

item.title: ChangeMamba: Remote Sensing Change Detection with Spatio-Temporal State Space Model
item.description: For the change decoder, which is available in all three architectures, we propose three spatio-temporal relationship modeling mechanisms, which can be naturally combined with the Mamba architecture and fully utilize its attribute to achieve spatio-temporal interaction of multi-temporal features and obtain accurate change information.

item.title: A Comprehensive Survey on Self-Supervised Learning for Recommendation
item.description: Recommender systems play a crucial role in tackling the challenge of information overload by delivering personalized recommendations based on individual user preferences.

item.title: To Search or to Recommend: Predicting Open-App Motivation with Neural Hawkes Process
item.description: The model, referred to as Neural Hawkes Process-based Open-App Motivation prediction model (NHP-OAM), employs a hierarchical transformer and a novel intensity function to encode multiple factors, and open-app motivation prediction layer to integrate time and user-specific information for predicting users' open-app motivations.

item.title: Know Your Neighbors: Improving Single-View Reconstruction via Spatial Vision-Language Reasoning
item.description: We propose KYN, a novel method for single-view scene reconstruction that reasons about semantic and spatial context to predict each point's density.

item.title: A Comparative Analysis of Word-Level Metric Differential Privacy: Benchmarking The Privacy-Utility Trade-off
item.description: The application of Differential Privacy to Natural Language Processing techniques has emerged in relevance in recent years, with an increasing number of studies published in established NLP outlets.

item.title: How does Multi-Task Training Affect Transformer In-Context Capabilities? Investigations with Function Classes
item.description: Large language models (LLM) have recently shown the extraordinary ability to perform unseen tasks based on few-shot examples provided as text, also known as in-context learning (ICL).

item.title: Learning Transferable Negative Prompts for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Existing prompt learning methods have shown certain capabilities in Out-of-Distribution (OOD) detection, but the lack of OOD images in the target dataset in their training can lead to mismatches between OOD images and In-Distribution (ID) categories, resulting in a high false positive rate.

item.title: HAPNet: Toward Superior RGB-Thermal Scene Parsing via Hybrid, Asymmetric, and Progressive Heterogeneous Feature Fusion
item.description: In this study, we take one step toward this new research area by exploring a feasible strategy to fully exploit VFM features for RGB-thermal scene parsing.

item.title: MonoCD: Monocular 3D Object Detection with Complementary Depths
item.description: Monocular 3D object detection has attracted widespread attention due to its potential to accurately obtain object 3D localization from a single image at a low cost.

item.title: Edisum: Summarizing and Explaining Wikipedia Edits at Scale
item.description: To overcome this problem and help editors write useful edit summaries, we propose a model for recommending edit summaries generated by a language model trained to produce good edit summaries given the representation of an edit diff.

item.title: Schroedinger's Threshold: When the AUC doesn't predict Accuracy
item.description: The Area Under Curve measure (AUC) seems apt to evaluate and compare diverse models, possibly without calibration.

item.title: ReFT: Representation Finetuning for Language Models
item.description: LoReFT is a drop-in replacement for existing PEFTs and learns interventions that are 10x-50x more parameter-efficient than prior state-of-the-art PEFTs.

item.title: On the Surprising Efficacy of Distillation as an Alternative to Pre-Training Small Models
item.description: We observe that, when distilled on a task from a pre-trained teacher model, a small model can achieve or surpass the performance it would achieve if it was pre-trained then finetuned on that task.

item.title: Intent Detection and Entity Extraction from BioMedical Literature
item.description: Biomedical queries have become increasingly prevalent in web searches, reflecting the growing interest in accessing biomedical literature.

item.title: SP$^2$OT: Semantic-Regularized Progressive Partial Optimal Transport for Imbalanced Clustering
item.description: To be more precise, we employ the strategy of majorization to reformulate the SP$^2$OT problem into a Progressive Partial Optimal Transport problem, which can be transformed into an unbalanced optimal transport problem with augmented constraints and can be solved efficiently by a fast matrix scaling algorithm.

item.title: Locating and Editing Factual Associations in Mamba
item.description: We investigate the mechanisms of factual recall in the Mamba state space model.

item.title: AutoWebGLM: Bootstrap And Reinforce A Large Language Model-based Web Navigating Agent
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have fueled many intelligent agent tasks, such as web navigation -- but most existing agents perform far from satisfying in real-world webpages due to three factors: (1) the versatility of actions on webpages, (2) HTML text exceeding model processing capacity, and (3) the complexity of decision-making due to the open-domain nature of web.

item.title: BanglaAutoKG: Automatic Bangla Knowledge Graph Construction with Semantic Neural Graph Filtering
item.description: Knowledge Graphs (KGs) have proven essential in information processing and reasoning applications because they link related entities and give context-rich information, supporting efficient information retrieval and knowledge discovery; presenting information flow in a very effective manner.

item.title: Two Tricks to Improve Unsupervised Segmentation Learning
item.description: We present two practical improvement techniques for unsupervised segmentation learning.

item.title: LeGrad: An Explainability Method for Vision Transformers via Feature Formation Sensitivity
item.description: Vision Transformers (ViTs), with their ability to model long-range dependencies through self-attention mechanisms, have become a standard architecture in computer vision.

item.title: DiffDet4SAR: Diffusion-based Aircraft Target Detection Network for SAR Images
item.description: Aircraft target detection in SAR images is a challenging task due to the discrete scattering points and severe background clutter interference.
